section.title: Events
section.para: Events represent's &THIS.RA;'s messages related to dialog and components. Events are fired on Dialog. Below sections detail different type of events, depending on cause of it being fired into SLEE.

section.title: Component
section.para: Below events are fired into SLEE when something happens with components passed in &THIS.RA; messages.

important.para: For proper render of this table prefixes, for entries on some columns are omitted. For prefix values, for each column, please see list below:
Version for all defined events is 1.0
Vendor for all defined events is org.mobicents
Spaces where introduced in Name column values, to correctly render the table. Please remove them when using copy/paste.

row.entry: Fired when Invoke is received by underlying TCAP stack
Fired when locally initiated Invoke does not receive any answer for extended period of time.
Fired when remote end rejects component for some reason.
Fired when remote end responded to invoke sent earlier indicating that there are more response to arrive.
Fired when remote end responded to invoke sent earlier indicating that this is last response.
Fired when remote peer indicates abnormal component. It indicates some protocol error in component sent from local peer.

section.title: Dialog
section.para: Dialog events are fired into SLEE to indicate basic occurrence of dialog related data.

important.para: For proper render of this table prefixes, for entries on some columns are omitted. For prefix values, for each column, please see list below:
Version for all defined events is 1.0
Vendor for all defined events is org.mobicents
Spaces where introduced in Name column values, to correctly render the table. Please remove them when using copy/paste.

row.entry: Indicates TCAP stack received uni-direction dialog. Dialog will be released automatically
Event indicate new Dialog is initiated by peer.
Event indicates continuation of existing dialog
Either local stack or peer stack aborted dialog
Fired when abnormal message is received within dialog. For instance when when duplicated InvokeID or wrong operation is received.
Fired when Dialog and all the resources related to dialog are released. This is last event on this activity after which activity will end.
Fired when dialog is about to timeout. Depending on configuration RA may sustain dialog or let it timeout. This event is fired when there is no activity on dialog for extended period of time.
Indicates all the component events are fired.
